definition_data: {"word": "arrange", "phonetic": "/əˈrændʒ/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["She arranged the flowers in a beautiful vase.", "He arranged to meet his friends at the park.", "The conference was arranged by the event planners.", "Can you arrange the schedule for the team?", "The travel agent arranged the flights and hotel.", "The musician arranged the piece for a string quartet."], "definition": "to organize, plan, or prepare something in advance, including musical compositions or events", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "verb", "definition_native": "organiser, planifier ou préparer à l'avance, y compris des compositions musicales ou des événements"}], "translations": ["organiser", "préparer", "mettre en ordre", "organiser un événement", "disposer"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}

definition_data: {"word": "approach", "phonetic": "/əˈproʊtʃ/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["The company is taking a new approach to marketing.", "Her approach to problem-solving is very methodical.", "The scientist's approach to the experiment was innovative.", "The approach to the holiday was relaxed and casual.", "The approach to the topic was from a historical perspective."], "definition": "A way of dealing with something; a method or technique, often used in a broader context.", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "noun", "definition_native": "Une approche pour traiter quelque chose, souvent utilisée dans un contexte plus large."}, {"examples": ["The car approached the intersection slowly.", "As the deadline approaches, the team is working overtime.", "The storm is approaching the coast.", "She approached the topic with caution.", "The company is approaching its 10-year anniversary."], "definition": "To come near or closer to something or someone, either physically or metaphorically.", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "verb", "definition_native": "S'approcher de quelque chose ou de quelqu'un, que ce soit physiquement ou métaphoriquement."}], "translations": ["approche (noun)", "s'approcher (verb)"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}
